This application retrieves statistics information from Nordija\'s backend services and can only be used with the statistics services infrastructure provided by Nordija. Nordija\'s statistics services provide various information regarding the end user\'s behaviour on TV set-top boxes and Nordija\'s second screen applications.

This application presents data in charts and tables for various time frames for the recent year. For each time frame you may choose to see the top 3, 5 and 10 or the bottom 3, 5, and 10 events. By "top" we mean the most popular and by "bottom" we mean the least popular.

The current version processes statistics with respect to TV channels, TV programs, movie rentals and widget activations.

Depending on the type of event (channel or program, movie rentals etc.) there may be one or two different column charts. For channels and programs we usually have two column charts, one that shows the number of viewers and one that shows the total number of watched hours. For movie rentals and widget activations theres only one column chart showing the total number of happenings.

Bar charts or column charts show data for various time intervals.

If the chart time spans over a day (e.g. current day), then the chart shows data for each hour since midnight.

If the chart time spans over a week (e.g. current week), then the chart shows data for each day since sunday.

If the chart time spans over a month or less, then the chart shows data for each week in the month.

If the chart time spans over several months (e.g. current year) then the chart shows data for each months.

Depending on the type of event (channel or program, movie rentals etc.) there may be one or two different pie charts. For channels and programs we usually have two pie charts, one that shows the number of viewers and one that shows the total number of watched hours. For movie rentals and widget activations theres only one column chart showing the total number of happenings.

Contrary to the column charts pie charts show data for the whole period of time. Here we don\'t divide the data into smaller intervals.

Pie charts show both the exact number and the percentage of the happenings in each slice.

The settings page contains information which is necessary to set correctly up before the application can work properly. The main part of the settings is about the server address and port where the Nordija statistics services run and the user credentials which are necessary to authenticate against those services.

•

  • Server Address
    • : Must be the name or the IP address of the server running the Nordija\'s Statistics REST Services.

    •
  • Server Port
    • : Must be the port number of the Nordija\'s Statistics REST Services. It is 9119 per default.

    •
  • Connection Timeout
    • : Number of seconds the application should wait for responses from server before giving up. Default is 5 seconds.

    •
  • User name
    • : The User id which is required to authenticate when connecting to the Nordija\'s Statistics REST Services.

    •
  • Password
    • : The password which is required to authenticate when connecting to the Nordija\'s Statistics REST Services.

    •
  • Only WiFi
    • : Indicates whether the appication is allowed to fetch data from server when not on WiFi.
